page.title: 01LLANDERLO
page.content: This is a very rural area east of the town of Llanderlo. It consists of high class alluvial grazing land in the valley with less fertile land on the higher ground. The majority of people are farmers in white walled grey roofed farm houses and farm buildings. A few retired people having worked in the same area have homes along the two main roads. the Bethleham Rad along the valley and Gwynfe road running west to east though the higher ground. all the farms are dairy farms with large Freisan herds, and beef cattle as by productions. Sheep are brough down from the higher ground to fatten in the valley fields. According to an 80 yr old farmer this is the wettest year within memory and there were fears for the animals winter sileage. Llanderlo provides a
